description: Difference between (smallest square strictly greater than 2^n) and 2^n.
comments: If n is even, a(n) = 2*2^(n/2) + 1, since 2^n = (2^(n/2))^2, and  a(n) = (2^(n/2) + 1)^2 - (2^(n/2))^2 = 2*2^(n/2) + 1. - _Jean-Marc Rebert_, Mar 02 2016If n is odd, a(n) = 4*a(n-2) or 4*a(n-2) - 4*sqrt(a(n-2) + 2^(n-2)) + 1. - _Robert Israel_, Mar 02 2016
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
maple: f:= proc(n) local m;   if n::even then m:= 2*2^(n/2)+1   else m:= ceil(sqrt(2)*2^((n-1)/2))   fi;   m^2-2^nend proc:map(f, [$0..100]); # _Robert Israel_, Mar 02 2016
mathematica: ssg[n_]:=Module[{s=2^n},(1+Floor[Sqrt[s]])^2-s]; Array[ssg,50,0] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 22 2015 *)Table[((Floor[2^(n/2)] + 1)^2 - 2^n), {n, 0, 50}] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 03 2016 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 24 2000
